data.question: What is the yield based on magnesium for the synthesis of compound 1?
At what temperature was the mixture for compound 2 heated?
What is the optical bandgap for compound 1?
How does the particle size affect the SHG responses of compounds 1 and 2?
data.answer: The SHG responses increase as the particle sizes of compounds 1 and 2 increase and then become constant.

data.question: What method was used to measure the SHG signals of compound 1 and 2?
What is the calculated band gap for compound 2 according to theoretical calculations?
What are the main contributions to the top of the valence bands for compounds 1 and 2?
Is the solvent-free synthesis method considered a green route for preparing crystalline materials?
Do compounds 1 and 2 exhibit second-harmonic generation (SHG) responses?
Are the structures of compounds 1 and 2 centrosymmetric?
Did the synthesis of compound 2 require a longer time than compound 1?
Is the yield of compound 2 higher than that of compound 1?
Do compounds 1 and 2 have the same crystallographic space group?
What is the role of ethylenediamine in the synthesis of compound 1?
data.answer: It acts as a structure-directing agent.

data.question: What is the significance of the noncentrosymmetric structures of compounds 1 and 2?
data.answer: They are beneficial for producing second-harmonic-generation (SHG) responses.

data.question: What analytical technique was used to confirm the phase purity of compounds 1 and 2?
What is the main contribution of oxalate ligands in compounds 1 and 2 according to theoretical calculations?
data.answer: They make a major contribution to the SHG efficiencies of the compounds.

data.question: Was the synthesis of compound 1 performed at a higher temperature than compound 2?
Do compounds 1 and 2 have the same topology?
What is the role of N,N,N',N'-tetramethyl-1,3-propanediamine in the synthesis of compound 2?
data.answer: It acts as a structure-directing agent.
